snippet: Citing an anti-gay-rights law it called “inconsistent” with the conference’s values, the league will relocate neutral site championships....
abstract: Atlantic Coast Conference commissioner John Swofford says organization will move neutral-site championships out of North Carolina because of state's divisive law that curbs anti-discrimination protections for gay, lesbian and transgender people; move comes days after NCAA moved its championship games out of state, prompting Gov Pat McCrory to again ask that institutions respect judicial system to proceed without 'economic threats.'

byline.original: By MARC TRACY and ALAN BLINDER

lead_paragraph: Citing an anti-gay-rights law it called “inconsistent” with the conference’s values, the league will relocate neutral site championships.

headline.main: A.C.C. Pulls League Championships Out of North Carolina
headline.print_headline: A.C.C. Joins Exodus Over North Carolina Law
